Email Processing

Email Processing Settings

Loading email settings...
📧 Email Processing Not Configured

To enable real email processing, you need to configure IMAP credentials:

  1. Create a .env file in your project root
  2. Add your IMAP settings (see EMAIL_SETUP.md for details)
  3. Restart the server

Example configuration:

IMAP_HOST=imap.gmail.com
IMAP_PORT=993
IMAP_USER=your-support-email@gmail.com
IMAP_PASSWORD=your-app-password
IMAP_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=false

    Company Profile

    Email Ingest Rules

    How it works: Emails from customer domains in your system will automatically create tickets. If the sender email exists, a ticket is created for that customer. If the sender is new but their domain matches an existing customer domain, a new customer account is created and a ticket is generated. Confirmation emails with ticket links are sent automatically.

    System / Monitoring Senders

    Purpose: Emails from these addresses will be treated as system/monitoring sources. Tickets will be created under the "System" user instead of auto-creating customer accounts.
    No system senders configured
    Note: Built-in detection already handles common monitoring systems (Nagios, Zabbix, Datadog, etc.). Use this list for exact sender addresses from your environment.

    Expert Registration via Email

    How it works: Staff members can self-register as experts by sending an email with subject Register_Expert to your support inbox. Their email domain must match the Tenant Domain below. A welcome email with login credentials will be sent automatically.
    Only emails from this domain can register as experts. Example: if set to apoyar.eu, then john@apoyar.eu can register but john@gmail.com cannot.
    Test Email Processing
    Manually trigger email processing to check for new emails immediately (normally runs every 5 minutes)

    Support Settings

    When enabled, customers must accept or reject ticket resolutions via email. If accepted, they'll be asked to provide a CSAT rating. If rejected, the ticket will be reopened and the support team notified.

    Bulk Ticket Processing

    SLA Monitoring
    Controls how often the system automatically checks for SLA breaches and generates notifications.
    Minimum 60 seconds. Default 300 (5 minutes).
    Bulk Operations
    Controls batch processing for user-triggered bulk actions like running ticket rules. These settings help prevent server overload when processing large numbers of tickets.
    Minimum 3 seconds. Delay between processing each batch.
    Maximum 10. Number of items to process per batch.

    🔗 Integrations

    Microsoft Teams
    Manage tickets directly from Teams
    Not Connected Connected
    ⚠️ Requirements: Your Microsoft 365 tenant must allow custom Teams apps (sideloading). This setting is managed by your IT administrator in the Teams Admin Center.

    What we request: Only basic permissions to identify your organization (User.Read). We don't access your emails, files, or other data.
    Features:
    • Create tickets with raise ticket: [description]
    • Check status with status #123
    • View your assigned tickets with my tickets
    • Get AI-powered insights with trends
    • Search CMDB items with cmdb [search]
    ✓ Connected to: -
    Connected on: -
    Email Domains:
    Step 2: Install the bot in your Teams
    Download the app package and install it in Microsoft Teams:
    1. Download the ServiFlow Teams app package
    2. In Teams, go to Apps → Manage your apps
    3. Click Upload an app → Upload a custom app
    4. Select the downloaded manifest.zip file
    Slack
    Manage tickets directly from Slack
    Not Connected Connected
    Features:
    • Create tickets with /ticket create [description]
    • Check status with /ticket status #123
    • View your assigned tickets with /ticket list
    • Switch modes with /ticket mode
    • Get help with /ticket help
    ✓ Connected to: -
    Connected on: -
    Email Domains:
    More integrations coming soon: Email to Ticket, Webhooks...

    System Control

    ⚠️
    Testing Kill Switches
    These controls disable system functionality for testing purposes. Use with caution in production.

    Email Controls

    Send Updates to Experts
    Enable/disable email notifications to experts (ticket assignments, updates)
    Send Updates to Customers
    Enable/disable email notifications to customers (ticket status updates, responses)
    Process Emails
    Enable/disable inbound email processing (automatic ticket creation)
    Process SLA Notifications
    Enable/disable SLA breach checking and notifications
